intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. bracteata, commonly known as the bracted conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by the presence of bracts, which are modified leaves that often enclose the inflorescence. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. This plant is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
